<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: fix: Return error message for unexpected recaptcha errors
username_0: PR to help address issue #108 by returning an error message for unexpected ReCaptcha errors.
<issue_comment>username_0: Hey @eduardoboucas @VincentTam @alexwaibel just pinging you on this one, as I feel it's a super low-risk PR that could be merged in to to give additional info for a generic error that leads to quite a few issue reports. Not sure which of you has the power to approve and merge it. Thanks!

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Updates Angular Generator version. Fixes #389
username_0: The current version mentioned in the docs 0.9.2 throws a warning in the
"wiredep:app" task. Discussed at 
https://github.com/yeoman/yeoman.io/issues/389
<issue_comment>username_1: Looks good.

Did you made sure the tutorial is all working using this new version?
<issue_comment>username_2: We can't just update the version of generator-angular, all screenshots will be outdated and I'm pretty sure other things will need updating as well.
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_1 I checked that the tutorial is working with the new version. 

@username_2 The screenshots do not mention the generator version, but the options that the new version of generator shows are different in places. 

My concern was that unless people see #389, they will not be able to proceed with codelab.
<issue_comment>username_2: The screenshots don't mention the versions but are actually tied to the version. There are some visual differences to what generator-angular produces, so the screenshots will need to be updated so we don't confuse people.

![localhost_8000____and_localhost_9000____and_github__znc_jquery_com_](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6025224/7002192/ec904e08-dc46-11e4-8e53-1a302f7d4415.png)

The bottom browser window is the latest generator-angular.
<issue_comment>username_2: Well those have to be updated then.
<issue_comment>username_0: Okay, I understand how this can be confusing. Should I get screenshots with the new version and add them to this pull request?
<issue_comment>username_3: If we could get the screenshots for all updated screens landed in this PR that would be massively helpful. We know this can get a bit manual, so we appreciate any time you can spend on it.
<issue_comment>username_2: That would be awesome! :+1: Thanks!
<issue_comment>username_4: +1 for updated screens
<issue_comment>username_0: I will get the new screenshots and update this PR.
<issue_comment>username_3: Pinging @username_0 just in case you might have some time to look at this again :)
<issue_comment>username_0: Sorry for the delay guys. I have changed jobs and move cities in the past weekend. I will try to get this done as soon as possible.
<issue_comment>username_5: I think it's worth updating the version to latest as its a bit confusing to go through a tutorial and things actually be quite different to the latest version of Yeoman. Not to mention that issue mentioned earlier that I ran into and had to google around for.

Great tool though and awesome tutorial!
<issue_comment>username_1: @username_5 The thing is we don't have enough man power to keep this tutorial up to date with every new release. So not defining a version # would be even more confusing as the tutorial would become out of date and not match what our users are seeing...

This is not perfect, but it's probably the best we have currently. Maybe we could make the version used in the tutorial more prominent?
<issue_comment>username_5: I'm happy to spend some time in the weekend updating the tutorial and make pull request?
<issue_comment>username_1: @username_5 that would be very welcome!
<issue_comment>username_5: Will do. I'll include version number as I understand why you are using it now.
<issue_comment>username_5: I have been working on this today but I am working in Windows and I dont
know what it is but I have a process that is running on port 9000. I can
make everything work but the screen shots would have the address in the
browser ones.. I will try to figure out which process it is but I've been
trying to solve this for a bit now :-(.

Will let you know of my progress. Won't take me long to update the tutorial
once solved.

Cheers
Seth

Seth Reid | Web Consultant/Developer

column5:
[{'action': 'opened', 'author': 'bep', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2018-03-01T19:16:01Z', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': 'This commit adds support for theme composition and inheritance in Hugo.

With this, it helps thinking about a theme as a set of ordered components:

```toml
theme = ["my-shortcodes", "base-theme", "hyde"]
```

The theme definition example above in `config.toml` creates a theme with the 3 components with presedence from left to right.

So, Hugo will, for any given file, data entry etc., look first in the project, and then in `my-shortcode`, `base-theme` and lastly `hyde`.

Hugo uses two different algorithms to merge the filesystems, depending on the file type:

* For `i18n` and `data` files, Hugo merges deeply using the translation id and data key inside the files.
* For `static`, `layouts` (templates) and `archetypes` files, these are merged on file level. So the left-most file will be chosen.

The name used in the `theme` definition above must match a folder in `/your-site/themes`, e.g. `/your-site/themes/my-shortcodes`. There are  plans to improve on this and get a URL scheme so this can be resolved automatically.

Also note that a component that is part of a theme can have its own configuration file, e.g. `config.toml`. There are currently some restrictions to what a theme component can configure:

* `params` (global and per language)
* `menu` (global and per language)
* `outputformats` and `mediatypes`

The same rules apply here: The left-most param/menu etc. with the same ID will win. There are some hidden and experimental namespace support in the above, which we will work to improve in the future, but theme authors are encouraged to create their own namespaces to avoid naming conflicts.

A final note: Themes/components can also have a `theme` definition in their `config.toml` and similar, which is the "inheritance" part of this commit's title. This is currently not supported by the Hugo theme site. We will have to wait for some "auto dependency" feature to be implemented for that to happen, but this can be a powerful feature if you want to create your own theme-variant based on others.

Fixes #4460
Fixes #4450', 'title': 'Add support for theme composition and inheritance', 'type': 'issue'}]
column6:
<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Add support for theme composition and inheritance
username_0: This commit adds support for theme composition and inheritance in Hugo.

With this, it helps thinking about a theme as a set of ordered components:

```toml
theme = ["my-shortcodes", "base-theme", "hyde"]
```

The theme definition example above in `config.toml` creates a theme with the 3 components with presedence from left to right.

So, Hugo will, for any given file, data entry etc., look first in the project, and then in `my-shortcode`, `base-theme` and lastly `hyde`.

Hugo uses two different algorithms to merge the filesystems, depending on the file type:

* For `i18n` and `data` files, Hugo merges deeply using the translation id and data key inside the files.
* For `static`, `layouts` (templates) and `archetypes` files, these are merged on file level. So the left-most file will be chosen.

The name used in the `theme` definition above must match a folder in `/your-site/themes`, e.g. `/your-site/themes/my-shortcodes`. There are  plans to improve on this and get a URL scheme so this can be resolved automatically.

Also note that a component that is part of a theme can have its own configuration file, e.g. `config.toml`. There are currently some restrictions to what a theme component can configure:

* `params` (global and per language)
* `menu` (global and per language)
* `outputformats` and `mediatypes`

The same rules apply here: The left-most param/menu etc. with the same ID will win. There are some hidden and experimental namespace support in the above, which we will work to improve in the future, but theme authors are encouraged to create their own namespaces to avoid naming conflicts.

A final note: Themes/components can also have a `theme` definition in their `config.toml` and similar, which is the "inheritance" part of this commit's title. This is currently not supported by the Hugo theme site. We will have to wait for some "auto dependency" feature to be implemented for that to happen, but this can be a powerful feature if you want to create your own theme-variant based on others.

Fixes #4460
Fixes #4450

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Multi-line PowerShell script example is wrong
username_0: The example [To add multi-line PowerShell script covering an entire event](http://www.appveyor.com/docs/build-configuration) does not work for me. It says

    on_success: |
      if($true)
      {
        Write-Host "Success"
      }

But if done like this the code is executed as "cmd", not as "ps", and fails. I tried to guess the right syntax and used `on_success: ps |` in the first line which did not work either. After looking at [libgit2's appveyor.yml file](https://github.com/libgit2/libgit2/blob/master/appveyor.yml) I found that

    on_success:
      - ps: |
      if($true)
      {
        Write-Host "Success"
      }

works. It even works when adding other script lines before or after, very similar to the help page's next example that uses `- ps: >-`, but the above does not require the extra line breaks.

So I'm a bit confused. Why would I want to use `- ps: >-` if `- ps: |` works the same and does not require the extra line breaks?
<issue_comment>username_1: It's been fixed. Thank you!<issue_closed>
<issue_comment>username_0: Thanks! But below the example it still says "The extra line breaks used above are required", though there are no extra line breaks anymore now :-)
<issue_comment>username_1: Good catch! It's been removed.

<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Include Carl's energy article on NFT page
username_0: https://blog.ethereum.org/2021/05/18/country-power-no-more/

We should align the calculations if possible and/or just link to it as another resource. 

We can also use this to help form the energy page on ethereum.org
<issue_comment>username_1: Agreed! Relevant to #3020 as well.<issue_closed>
<issue_comment>username_2: Closed in #3777 😬

 {'action': 'created', 'author': 'devlead', 'comment_id': 713536293.0, 'datetime': '2020-10-21 12:34:06+00:00', 'masked_author': 'username_3', 'text': 'In `build.ps1` we set
```PowerShell
$env:DOTNET_SKIP_FIRST_TIME_EXPERIENCE=1
$env:DOTNET_CLI_TELEMETRY_OPTOUT=1
$env:DOTNET_ROLL_FORWARD_ON_NO_CANDIDATE_FX=2
```
but in `build.sh`
```bash
export DOTNET_SKIP_FIRST_TIME_EXPERIENCE=1
export DOTNET_CLI_TELEMETRY_OPTOUT=1
export DOTNET_SYSTEM_NET_HTTP_USESOCKETSHTTPHANDLER=0
```
the `DOTNET_ROLL_FORWARD_ON_NO_CANDIDATE_FX` is missing in bash file.', 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}

column6:
<issue_start><issue_comment>Title: Change to H2 for TOC
username_0: We currently use H1 in our document pages to build the TOC on the right hand column. To follow semantic best practices we should only have one H1 on the page (the title) and use headings starting with H2 for structuring page content.

We would need to configure Wyam to pickup H2 for building the TOC
<issue_comment>username_1: I can take care of this.
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_1 Great. Let me know if you have questions or need further information.
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_1 Are you still interested in giving this a try? Do you need any further information?
<issue_comment>username_1: Hey, yes I am.
I've been pretty busy lately. Thank you for your patience.
<issue_comment>username_1: @username_0 I've started do some digging and tried to get the site up and running but after running a build I am greeted with the following output. 

`It was not possible to find any compatible framework version
The framework 'Microsoft.NETCore.App', version '2.1.0' was not found.
  - The following frameworks were found:
      3.1.9 at [C:\Program Files\dotnet\shared\Microsoft.NETCore.App]

You can resolve the problem by installing the specified framework and/or SDK.

The specified framework can be found at:
  - https://aka.ms/dotnet-core-applaunch?framework=Microsoft.NETCore.App&framework_version=2.1.0&arch=x64&rid=win10-x64`

I already checked the link and it seems like it is no longer offered. Is a downgrade really the onyl way to go here?
<issue_comment>username_0: @username_1 Can you please list what exactly you did, how you run the build and what OS/Version?
<issue_comment>username_2: @username_0 I am actually seeing a similar problem on my Mac when testing today...

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1271146/96719552-6f209200-13a1-11eb-9585-7111c2c09976.png)

To get this to happen, I ran:

```
git clean -xfd
```

To get to a clean slate, and then I ran:

```
./build.sh --target=preview
```
<issue_comment>username_3: In `build.ps1` we set
```PowerShell
$env:DOTNET_SKIP_FIRST_TIME_EXPERIENCE=1
$env:DOTNET_CLI_TELEMETRY_OPTOUT=1
$env:DOTNET_ROLL_FORWARD_ON_NO_CANDIDATE_FX=2
```
but in `build.sh`
```bash
export DOTNET_SKIP_FIRST_TIME_EXPERIENCE=1
export DOTNET_CLI_TELEMETRY_OPTOUT=1
export DOTNET_SYSTEM_NET_HTTP_USESOCKETSHTTPHANDLER=0
```
the `DOTNET_ROLL_FORWARD_ON_NO_CANDIDATE_FX` is missing in bash file.
<issue_comment>username_2: @username_3 ooo, testing this just now...
<issue_comment>username_2: @username_3 new PR raised here:

https://github.com/cake-build/website/pull/1149
<issue_comment>username_1: Sorry for the late reply. I am currently using Win10. 
As far as I remember the steps were the following:

- Install cake `dotnet tool install Cake.Tool` (I think I had no version specified)
- Install wyam `dotnet tool install -g Wyam.Tool` 
- tried to run the build with `wyam build --target=Build`

Sorry I let you all wait for so long. 
Please feel free to assign this issue to someone else.
Work is pretty draining atm and I am not doing much besides that.

column5:
[{'action': 'opened', 'author': 'tannewt', 'comment_id': None, 'datetime': '2020-09-15T01:33:12Z', 'masked_author': 'username_0', 'text': 'This PR aggregates outstanding PRs into one so that pending PRs will not have overlapping PIDs. New PRs can be made directly to [this PR's branch for future requests](https://github.com/username_0/pidcodes.github.com). However, requests will only be accepted after the project has been [certified by OSHWA](https://certification.oshwa.org/). I don't want to arbitrate whether a project is open enough when we already have an org with a process for that.

Existing PRs will be merged into this PR if they are clearly and openly documented and do not break the site build. Others will be skipped with a note about why below.

Closed source projects are expected to purchase their own VID: https://www.usb.org/getting-vendor-id

Fixes #549 

Here is the status of outstanding PRs:
- [x] [PR 493 - Fixed index.md file(s)](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/493) Not merged, author asked for PR to be closed.
- [x] [PR 494 - added AXIOM Beta and AXIOM Remote devices ](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/494) Merged
- [x] [PR 504 - Requesting PID FFB0 for OpenFFBoard](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/504) Merged
- [x] [PR 508 - Request for PID 5750 with VID 0x1209 for CUAV autopilot.](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/508) **NOT** merged. No native source files for the hardware.
- [x] [PR 510 - Request pid for Comrade P1](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/510) Merged. Open source software only. Existing hardware.
- [x] [PR 513 - Add 1209/B737 - LrLite](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/513) **NOT** merged. No native source files for the hardware.
- [x] [PR 515 - Updated website details](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/515) Merged. Info update.
- [x] [PR 516 - added 0x0h.com and ours first device](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/516) Merged. Hardware is public domain on EasyEDA and software is MIT.
- [x] [PR 517 - Request PID for LNE projects](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/517) **NOT** merged. No obvious hardware files.
- [x] [PR 518 - Added the MIDI2CV modules.](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/518) Merged.
- [x] [PR 519 - Requesting PID 0xCACE](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/519) Merged.
- [x] [PR 520 - PID(8250) request for usbip-win virtual hub](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/520) Merged. Software-only for Windows. Source is GPL 3
- [x] [PR 521 - Request PID C550 for ch55xduino](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/521) Merged. Hardware files look like Eagle
- [x] [PR 522 - Add Command Deck device (requesting VID 1209 / PID F0DA)](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/522) Merged. Software only. Hardware is breadboarded.
- [x] [PR 523 - Adding PowerMon ](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/523) Merged. Code is basic but hardware files are there. README says MIT.
- [x] [PR 524 - Add Fabio Pugliese Ornellas 3D Printed Keyboard 2](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/524) Merged. No PCB design. 3D files available.
- [x] [PR 525 - Request for VID 1209:5114 for the Silver project](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/525) Merged. Link goes to firmware and its README has link to hardware files.
- [x] [PR 526 - Added own organisation and PID](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/526) Merged. Some site links are bad but the repo is available with source.
- [x] [PR 527 - uCANDevices](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/527) Merged.
- [x] [PR 528 - Added lophtware's USB2.0 Type-C / PIC32 Breakout Board.](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/528) Merged. Clearly licensed and I think the raw files. Altium maybe?
- [x] [PR 529 - PID request for CatWAN Farmer](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/529) Merged. License is only noted in README. Code is Arduino examples.
- [x] [PR 530 - Request for PID 5555](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/530) Merged. License is clear. Hardware files in zip but in native Kicad format.
- [x] [PR 531 - ErgoKB Phoenix Board](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/531) Merged. Existing open firmware. Hardware is open, kicad files.
- [x] [PR 532 - Request PID 8787 & 8788](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/532) **NOT** merged. Files say explicitly "All rights reserved".
- [x] [PR 533 - Request PID C0D4 for Autumnal](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/533) **NOT** merged. No obvious hardware files even though the code appears to be for custom hardware.
- [x] [PR 534 - Request PID 0x7522 for Makbit MIDI2USB device.](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/534) Merged.
- [x] [PR 535 - Use same PID code for ODrive v4 also](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/535) Merged. Updated info.
- [x] [PR 538 - PID Request for RE5](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/538) Merged. Hardware MIT. Firmware is QMK.
- [x] [PR 539 - Submit PID request for Abies](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/539) **NOT** merged. No clear firmware.
- [x] [PR 540 - PID Request for te96](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/540) Merged. Same person as 538.
- [x] [PR 541 - Adding CM20](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/541) Merged. Software is micro:bit and hardware files are in `assets`.
- [x] [PR 542 - PID request for BastWIFI](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/542) Merged. Link is only to wifi but software is CircuitPython, an open source version.
- [x] [PR 543 - Add Lab11 org and TotTag device with PID 5000](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/543) Merged. All MIT.
- [x] [PR 544 - Requesting PID 0D11 and 0D10 for Odiin](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/544) Merged. All firmware. Hardware is breadboarded with a bridge that is open.
- [x] [PR 545 - Add uwmisl org and PurpleDrop PID](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/545) Merged.
- [x] [PR 546 - Updated usage of 4321](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/546) Merged.
- [x] [PR 547 - PID request for N32B](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/547) Merged.
- [x] [PR 548 - add rrainey organization and associated pid codes](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/548) Merged.
- [x] [PR 550 - Request PID 2344 for MoaRGB project](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/550) **NOT** merged. No hardware files.
- [x] [PR 551 - add LinklayerLabs org and CANtact Pro device (0x1209/0x1111)](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/551) **NOT** merged. source link is broken.
- [x] [PR 552 - sinara/stabilizer: add org and pid](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/552) **NOT** merged. No license in hardware repo.
- [x] [PR 553 - Request for the probe-rs project's HS probe, an open source probe](https://github.com/pidcodes/pidcodes.github.com/pull/553) Merged.', 'title': 'Aggregate PR', 'type': 'issue'}

I just have filled form on OSHWA certification.", 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}

I think it's safe to use the PID because it hasn't conflicted with anyone else. It won't be official until it is actually merged.", 'title': None, 'type': 'comment'}

<issue_comment>username_0: Hi @username_1, it won't appear on the webpage until this PR or yours is merged by @Arachnid. My intent with this PR was to make it easy for @Arachnid to get caught up and to also ensure there are no conflicts between pending requests. I think it's safe to use the PID because it hasn't conflicted with anyone else. It won't be official until it is actually merged.
<issue_comment>username_0: Ok, #527, #544 and #565 were removed because they use new 0xxx PIDs.
<issue_comment>username_2: @username_0 thanks!
